intro: Scaevola swezeyana, commonly known as the Hawaiian ice plant, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a frost-like appearance. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Scaevola swezeyana is an important component of Hawaii's unique flora and is adapted to the island's specific ecological conditions.
